content.question: One end of a string is attached to the ceiling with the other end attached to a toy. The toy can be set into motion such that it travels in a horizontal circular path at a constant tangential speed, as shown above. The toy experiences a component of the tension force toward the center of the circular path that serves as the centripetal force exerted on the toy. Which of the following measurements could a student use to determine the net centripetal force exerted on the toy? Select two answers.

choices.label: Use a scale to determine the mass of the toy. Use a protractor to determine the angle <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> between a vertical line and the angle that the string makes with the vertical line.

Use a stopwatch to determine the time for the toy to complete one revolution. Use a meterstick to measure the radius of the toy’s circular path, <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Use a scale to determine the mass of the toy.

Use a stopwatch to determine the time for the toy to complete one revolution. Use a meterstick to determine the length, <math alttext="l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>l</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, of the string. Use a meterstick to measure the radius of the toy’s circular path, <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Use a stopwatch to determine the time for the toy to complete one revolution. Use a meterstick to determine the length, <math alttext="l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>l</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, of the string. Use a scale to determine the mass of the toy.

content.answer: Use a scale to determine the mass of the toy. Use a protractor to determine the angle <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> between a vertical line and the angle that the string makes with the vertical line.
